feedback.incorrect:
Incorrect. Here are the correct statements.
Good citizens consider different perspectives on issues before making their own judgments.
You can learn more about issues in your area from trusted adults and the media.
People who want to build superstores say it will improve life for a city through lower prices and cleaning up an older area.
People against offshore oil drilling express concern for the health and safety of people and the environment.
People who would increase the minimum driving age mention the higher rates of accidents among those who lack experience.
People against increasing government spending on emergency assistance for those in poverty say that more long-term solutions need to be found and that current programs are helping.
